alert.note: Alert for Lower Yukon River; Lower Yukon and Innoko Valleys; Yukon Delta Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 26 at 5:43AM AKST until December 26 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 50 below zero occuring. * WHERE...Yukon Delta Coast, Lower Yukon River and Lower Yukon and Innoko Valleys. * WHEN...Until noon AKST today. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The coldest wind chills are between Anvik and Mountain Village. Temperatures are expected to increase this afternoon with wind chills becoming less severe then.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: Lower Yukon River; Lower Yukon and Innoko Valleys; Yukon Delta Coast
